page.title: 02Northorpe Landscape:Building
page.content: The aerial photograph (A) shows the viturally flat landscape, a patchwork of fields with villages here and there. A small village with one or two outlying farms, Northorpe has 2 old stone farmhouses (Charity Farm- house and 300 year old{Northorpe {Manor)}and several (renovated) stone cottages. "Amaryllis" on the market at Â£38,000 has some herringbone brickwork The{Old Vicarage}and{Northorpe Hall were designed by Goldsmith and built in the 1870s. Northorpe Hall stands in parkland and is close to the site of the 16 C manor house.{(Old Hall)}In 1985 the house and 6.5 acres of land fetched Â£108,000 at public auction: the (Scotter) buyer plans to convert the house to a restaurant. 7 listed buildings are those marked above and Rose Cottage, Church Hall, 6 Monson Road - Grade 2; the Church - Grade 1.
